message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

The paper focuses on sentiment analysis of citations in scientific papers, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The use of word2vec and support vector machines for classification suggests a focus on machine learning techniques, which narrows down the sub-categories to cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The use of Anthology Collections (ACL-Embeddings) and polarity-specific word embeddings (PS-Embeddings) suggests a focus on language modeling and representation learning, which further supports the cs.CL sub-category. However, the use of classifiers and evaluation metrics suggests a focus on supervised learning, which could also fit under cs.LG (Learning). The use of word embeddings and deep learning techniques also suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and deep learning (cs.DL).
